contextNotes: Updated with Navy Federal rate reductions. Comparing three strategies: Avalanche (highest interest first), Snowball (smallest balance first), and hybrid approach optimized for MMI enrollment and promotional deadline defense.

avalanche.description: Pay off debts in order of highest to lowest APR to minimize total interest paid
payoffOrder: 1. Promotional balances (defend all 6 deadlines to save $1,971.44)
8. SoFi Personal Loan ($40,735.15 @ 17.89%) - LARGEST INTEREST COST
avalanche.monthlyMilestones: Promotional balances cleared Jan-May 2026, high-rate cards eliminated 2026-2027, SoFi loan cleared 2029, Navy Federal reduced-rate cards 2030-2031, MMI debts 2031-2032, remaining debts 2032-2033
avalanche.keyAdvantage: Minimizes total interest paid - saves ~$8,500 from Navy Federal rate reductions
avalanche.psychologicalChallenge: SoFi loan ($40,735) takes 3+ years to eliminate - requires patience

snowball.description: Pay off debts from smallest to largest balance for psychological momentum
snowball.keyAdvantage: 10 quick wins in first year - massive psychological momentum
snowball.psychologicalBenefit: Eliminates 10 debts by end of 2026, freed minimums compound quickly
snowball.financialCost: Costs extra $26,270 in interest vs avalanche, takes 20 more months
snowball.criticalFlaw: Leaves SoFi ($40,735 @ 17.89%) bleeding $606/month in interest for years 1-8

consolidation.assessment: User already enrolled in MMI debt management program covering 8 debts ($77,778.92) with negotiated rates 3.2%-9.9%. Three Navy Federal cards just received rate reductions to 9.9%.

additionalConsolidationOptions.option: Balance Transfer for High-Rate Amex Cards
additionalConsolidationOptions.viability: Moderate - credit score unknown, high utilization may limit approval
additionalConsolidationOptions.risk: BT fee + potential for high ongoing rate if not paid off during promo

additionalConsolidationOptions.viability: Low - already at high rate, DTI 41% limits refinance options
additionalConsolidationOptions.risk: May not qualify for better rate given current debt load

additionalConsolidationOptions.viability: Low - cards already at competitive MMI rate of 9.9%
additionalConsolidationOptions.benefit: Single payment instead of 3 separate accounts
additionalConsolidationOptions.drawback: Likely higher rate than current 9.9% MMI negotiated rates

consolidation.recommendation: STAY WITH MMI + STRATEGIC EXTRA PAYMENTS
consolidation.reasoning: MMI already provides excellent rates (3.2%-9.9%) on $77,778.92 in debt. Navy Federal rate reductions to 9.9% make further consolidation less attractive. Focus extra $500/month on non-MMI high-rate debts (Amex 28.74%, SoFi 17.89%, Aven 13.49%) using avalanche approach.
consolidation.totalInterestSaved: N/A - already in optimal consolidation via MMI

reasoning: User enrolled in MMI with excellent negotiated rates (3.2%-9.9%) covering $77,778.92 in debt
Navy Federal rate reductions create clear avalanche priority: non-MMI high-rate debts first
User has 'quick_wins' motivation style - need balance between math and psychology
$1,971.44 in promotional interest at risk - MUST defend these deadlines first
SoFi loan ($40,735 @ 17.89%) costs $606/month in interest - priority #1 after promos
Four Amex/Capital One cards at 27.99%-28.74% ($11,948.77) - priority #2
Avalanche saves $26,270 vs snowball and takes 20 months less
recommendation.hybridDescription: Phase 1 (Months 1-6): Defend all promotional deadlines to save $1,971.44. Phase 2 (Months 7+): Pure avalanche on high-rate debts (SoFi 17.89%, Amex/CapOne 27.99%-30.14%, Navy Federal 16.3%, Aven 13.49%). MMI debts stay on autopilot at $1,751/month. Auto loan and SBA EIDL pay minimums only - lowest priority.

expectedResults.firstMajorWin: All promotional balances cleared by May 2026 - $1,971.44 deferred interest SAVED
expectedResults.fourthMajorWin: Navy Federal reduced-rate cards cleared by 2031

paymentAllocation.allocationStrategy: MMI debts ($1,751/mo autopay) + Extra $500/mo to highest-rate non-MMI debt (promos first, then SoFi, then Amex/CapOne, then Navy Federal 16.3%, then Aven 13.49%)

winRate.firstYearDescription: 6 promotional balances + 2 PayPal standard balances cleared
winRate.psychologicalMomentum: High - 10 accounts closed in 2 years while saving maximum interest

recommendation.netBenefit: BEST OF BOTH WORLDS: Quick wins from promotional victories (8 debts in Year 1) + maximum interest savings from avalanche targeting ($26,270 less than snowball). Avalanche priority shift due to Navy Federal rate reductions means SoFi becomes undisputed #1 target.

rows.bestFor: Balanced approach: quick wins + max savings

rateReductionImpact.priorOrder: Before rate reductions, Navy Federal cards were positions 2-4 (16.7%, 14.1%, 12.1%)
rateReductionImpact.newOrder: After rate reductions, Navy Federal cards moved to positions 11-13 (all at 9.9%)
rateReductionImpact.keyShift: SoFi Personal Loan ($40,735 @ 17.89%) now UNDISPUTED priority #1 for non-promotional debt
rateReductionImpact.secondaryShift: Four Amex/CapOne cards (27.99%-30.14%) now clear priority #2 tier
rateReductionImpact.tertiaryShift: Navy Federal ***561145 ($4,431 @ 16.3%) is only remaining Navy Federal in high-rate tier
rateReductionImpact.strategicImplication: Focus shifts from Navy Federal cards to SoFi + Amex/CapOne cluster. Navy Federal reduced-rate cards ($33,446 total) now safely in medium-rate tier.
rateReductionImpact.interestSavingsTimeline: $162.14/month = $1,945.68/year = ~$8,500 lifetime savings from rate reductions alone

immediate: Pay Ashley PayPal $92 minimum ASAP (account $41 past due)
Set up MMI autopay $1,751/month if not already automated
Allocate $500 extra payment to PayPal THORUM/DELTA promos expiring 01/11/26
months1to6: Clear Ashley PayPal past due immediately
Eliminate all promotional balances by May 2026
months7plus: Unleash full $500/month extra on SoFi Personal Loan (17.89%)
Clear all 28-30% cards by end of 2027
Maintain MMI autopay, continue avalanche down the rate ladder
